intro: Lepidium montanum var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces distinctive, triangular seed pods. This variety is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and open slopes.
